text: German electronics company Escom AG bought the rights to the name, patents and intellectual property of Commodore Electronics Ltd. for $10 million. Commodore had gone bankrupt the year before.
The "I Love You" virus spread to 55 million computers around the world, hijacking hard drives and deleting, renaming, or damaging files. The damage reached billions of dollars.
Apple announced that Steve Jobs would kick off that year's Worldwide Developers Conference by talking about Mac OS X 10.4 Tiger.
